Module main.inventory
Package Controller

Class MainMenu

java.lang.Object
Controller.MainMenu
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainMenu extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The MainMenu controller class which acts as the main page for the application. Allows users to view, Add, Modify, Search, and Delete Parts and Products and Exit the application.

FUTURE ENHANCEMENT: Refactor redundant methods in controller classes into their own classes. For example, the two search methods in the Main Menu and the Add Product (controllers) search method can be condensed to a single method.

    • onDeletePart

      public void onDeletePart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Delete the selected Part or alert user no Part to be deleted is selected

      LOGICAL ERROR: Without the return call inside the first conditional check code block the application allowed a second dialog box to appear. This was incorrect logically because the first dialog box indicated that no part had been selected in the first place, therefore making a confirmation of deletion dialog box irrelevant until the user selected a part to delete. Adding a return call after the nullSelection alert resolved the error.

      Parameters:
      event - Delete (Part) Button clicked
